response: I loved the dplyr workshop, it was very helpful

multiple ways to do one certain job is interesting to know

Always good workshop

Great workshop!

Excellent job

Well done!
Everything! Everyone is incredibly helpful

Really good

Please allow us to have the original script
probably less R intro is needed to allow finishing all activities

Some sections too repetitive, especially if very familiar with ggplot. Would be good to specify audience for workshop, for someone that works with R a lot and ggplot, dplyr, etc... it might be a bit slow. But this is easily addressed by having a set schedule/contents online
Don't cover Intro to R, should be part of other workshop
Maybe give an overview of where to get shape and raster files (general resources), explain better the structure of shape & raster files

I think the Day 1 topics should be covered by each student separately (like sending the code and classes ahead) and dedicate 2 days on just working with geospatial data. Maybe having 2 hours to check our data, or have additional examples, reading external files. Maybe important to comment a little bit more the coding because we will like to remember sometimes in a quick way what the lines are doing.
I was expecting more info in spatial analysis and maybe in the future people can go over the basics of R online and focus this workshop on spatial data only (the whole 2 days)
Maybe less intro to R, make it strictly geospatial data
A bit fast today (day 2)
slow start, fast finish
I already had plenty of experience in R, it would be better to more focus on geospatial analysis for the people who are familiar with R, but thank you!
Some points were a little too slow, but they were important to people that are not familiar with R
I'd split the workshop into people who experience in R and don't, it was a lot of review
R intro too long (I would have skipped), a ppt or more organized presentation would have been useful for the geospatial concepts intro for those new to geography
Possibly too much background R, however this workshop is for beginners
More data, more plot types
Fast pace of some instructors
The morning session of basic set-up is a little bit too long, which makes the rest of the workshop a little bit in a rush
Less R intro, more time for geospatial, and slower
Maybe do not cover R intro in this workshop, have pre-req to ask folks to get into this workshop they already have intro R
Got faster or cut the intro a little bit, schedule people that know the R intro to arrive after

Maybe an icebreaker at the beginning to know each background or names, the classes were in the Data Carpentry website so maybe saying this at the beginning to also follow a little bit the graphs and codes
Introduction to dplyr & ggplot could have been better with interesting challenging examples
